NewWords.WordPhrase: v. admit or recognize sth. 承认
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. They refused to acknowledge that they were defeated.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. having knowledge or experience of sth. 知道的，明白的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He doesn't seem to be aware of the risk.
e.g. The cat was beneath the chair.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. completely different 相反的   to the contrary 相反的（地）
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. In spite of all the evidence to the contrary, Holmes was convinced the woman was innocent.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. explain what sth. is 定义，详细说明
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The teacher defined each confusing word for the students.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. upset 使苦恼，使不安，扰乱
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. If she's asleep, don't disturb her.
e.g. They embraced each other tenderly on the station platform.
e.g. With my parents away I've got the house all to myself.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. show that sth. is necessary, or that there is a good reason for sth. 证明…是正当的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He could not justify his absence from class this morning.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. allowed by law 合法的，法定的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The children's legal rights must be protected.
e.g. Don't let go of the handle.
e.g. The children are looking forward to the Spring Festival.
e.g. Don't disturb him. He's in a very bad mood.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. an idea 观念，想法
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He had a sudden notion to leave.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. make smooth, bright and shiny by continual rubbing 擦亮
a. not often found or done 稀罕的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. It's very rare for her to be late.
e.g. She responded to my letter with a phone call.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. reason 缘故，理由   for one's sake out of consideration for; for the benefit of 为了…的缘故；为了…的利益
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He changed into old shoes for the sake of comfort.
